solution_line_template: While in Bali, Palmer took {photos_first_week} pictures in the first week and thus {multiplier_second_week} * {photos_first_week} photos = <<{photos_first_week}*{multiplier_second_week}={photos_second_week}>>{photos_second_week} photos in the second week.

The total number of photos she took in Bali is {photos_first_week} photos on the first week + {photos_second_week} photos on the second week + {photos_third_fourth_weeks_from_solution} photos = <<{photos_first_week}+{photos_second_week}+{photos_third_fourth_weeks_from_solution}={total_photos_bali}>>{total_photos_bali} photos.

When she adds the photos she from Bali to her album, Palmer has a total of {total_photos_bali} +{initial_album_photos} = <<{total_photos_bali}+{initial_album_photos}={final_total_photos}>>{final_total_photos} photos.
